Seattle - Location, Climate, and Geography

Seattle is located on an isthmus between Puget Sound (a part of Pacific Ocean) and Lake Washington. The city is about 100 miles south of the Canadaâ€“United States border and about 800 miles north of San Francisco. It has a reputation for the abundance of rain. It has an average of 152 rainy days and gets 37 inches of rain each year. Despite having many rainy days, it is a beautiful city, and its summer is very pleasant. The famous snowy Olympic Mountains and Mount Rainier can be seen from afar. The city itself has three major lakes, which are Lake Union, Green Lake, and Lake Washington. Locals and tourists love to relax, jog and bike by these lakes. Summer is dry in the city, and the average temperature is about 75 degrees in July and August. During summer, people like to go hiking in mountains in the Snoqualime region, about 55 miles east of the city.
